Description.Name: Odd Distress Call
Description.Details: Sumire catches your attention on the bridge. "Commander, I've picked up a distress call coming from a small moon, approximately two kilometres outside a nearby pirate base. Seems sketchy though." Murad quickly interjects, "Yes, it does, yet the message itself was encoded in Hexadecimal using a very old computer speak from centuries ago. See for yourself..." You look at the screen and can barely make out the gibberish with the odd legible word here and there. 5 0 5 1 907 2 9E7 A 11F7 FA57 1 907 250000 CB1115 4 A55157 1 907 A B16 BAD B07 4 A55157 2 175 A 900D DEA1 4 A11 5 0 5 "The coordinates lead to an abandoned mine shaft exit at the other side of the ridgeline. I doubt any random pirate would set up such an elaborate trap." "If I'm reading this right, the reward is 250 000 CBills and a mech for an extraction?", you wonder. Sumire shrugs, "Actually, the ridgeline is high enough for me to make an approach without tripping up any sensors so it's not that bad a pickup spot, all things considered." "Well, it's up to you Commander.", Dr. Murad prompts

Description.Name: Nothing happens
Description.Details:
You decide to disregard the message as it's not worth the risk. In your eyes, nothing is ever as easy as it seems and if it's too good to be true, it most likely is.

Hours later Sumire approaches you with a report, "Commander, as we passed the moon, we had a clear Line of Sight on the mineshaft. It appears there was someone waiting nearby in a weird makeshift pressure suit?"

"Oh well, hope the little guy makes it.", you chuckle as you try to shrug it off,

Description.Name: Rescue
Description.Details: When the Leopard arrives at the source of the distress beacon, you see a small little man stumbling out in something akin to a makeshift pressure suit. It appears his air is getting low. Your tech staff manage to quickly scoop him up before the pirate forces even realize what is happening. The little man introduces himself as Uncle Bubby. He is a technician that mainly salvages in hostile environments. During one of his salvage runs, he spotted a mech pilot in distress and quickly ran over to provide assistance. After a quick field repair, the pilot was able to make it back home...to their pirate base. At that point, Uncle Bubby, was recruited to their languishing MechBays. They even went as far as to move him around to their satellite bases periodically. Uncle Bubby continues, "Can you believe this was my third escape attempt? Seems like most folks wouldn't give me the time of day! Thank the Maker, you guys showed up. Trust me, you got a friend for life in good ol' Uncle Bubby. As agreed, I'll give you one of my custom mechs as payment. It's a Falcon!" Yang snorts, "A Faclon? O.K. I mean, are you sure - they're pretty rare but we'll gladly take it." "Now don't you worry about that. You did me a solid and I have to sweeten the deal. This is not just any Falcon, mind you but something even more rare...it's a Royal Falcon replete with two medium lasers and a genuine Snub-nose PPC." Yang is left speechless by the sales pitch. Breaking the silence, you reply, "That's quite impressive! We appreciate the gift." Without missing a beat, Uncle Bubby quips, "Trust me, you made a buddy for life. If you are ever in the Periphery again, don't be a stranger. I'll hook you guys up with even better gear then!"
